customer_addr:
7628 Paul Weitz st
Las Vegas, NV 89145

citations.narrative:
An indoor enclosure housing one adult dog had an empty water bowl at the time of inspection. According to the licensee,
this dog frequently spills his water bowl. The licensee provided water to the dog which drank a small amount calmly and
comfortably without notable thirst. Constant access to potable water is necessary to ensure that dogs remain adequately
hydrated as needed throughout the day. The facility must ensure that all dogs have continuous access to potable water at
all times, unless restricted by the attending veterinarian or excepted as provided in 3.17(a).
Correct from this day, 11/21/2025, forward.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Within the large, back room where the dog crates are located were two cluttered, disorganized storage shelves used to
store some miscellaneous items not used for animal purposes including tool items, plastic bags and a fuel can. Also within
the room were two tables which were covered with cluttered miscellaneous items including papers, plastic bags, clumps
of hair, rolls of tape, and cords. Premises where housing facilities are located, including surrounding buildings and
surrounding grounds, and other animal areas must be kept clean, free of clutter and in good repair to protect the animals
from injury, to prevent the harborage of pests, and to facilitate the husbandry practices required in this subpart. A system
of maintaining effective housekeeping practices must be in place to protect the health and well-being of the animals.
Correct by 11/30/2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.10(a) 
   
Watering 
An indoor enclosure housing one adult dog had an empty water bowl at the time of inspection. According to the licensee, 
this dog frequently spills his water bowl. The licensee provided water to the dog which drank a small amount calmly and 
comfortably without notable thirst. Constant access to potable water is necessary to ensure that dogs remain adequately 
hydrated as needed throughout the day. The facility must ensure that all dogs have continuous access to potable water at 
all times, unless restricted by the attending veterinarian or excepted as provided in 3.17(a). 
 
Correct from this day, 11/21/2025, forward. 
3.11(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Within the large, back room where the dog crates are located were two cluttered, disorganized storage shelves used to 
store some miscellaneous items not used for animal purposes including tool items, plastic bags and a fuel can. Also within 
the room were two tables which were covered with cluttered miscellaneous items including papers, plastic bags, clumps 
of hair, rolls of tape, and cords. Premises where housing facilities are located, including surrounding buildings and 
surrounding grounds, and other animal areas must be kept clean, free of clutter and in good repair to protect the animals 
from injury, to prevent the harborage of pests, and to facilitate the husbandry practices required in this subpart. A system 
of maintaining effective housekeeping practices must be in place to protect the health and well-being of the animals. 
 
Correct by 11/30/2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
